title: Data science lifecycle & Exploratory data analysis using visualization
learning_objectives: Learners can list the six elements of the data science lifecycle.

title: Data science lifecycle & Exploratory data analysis using visualization
learning_objectives: Learners can describe the four main aesthetic mappings that can be used to visualise data using the ggplot2 R Package.

title: Data science lifecycle & Exploratory data analysis using visualization
learning_objectives: Learners can control the colour scaling applied to a plot using colour as an aesthetic mapping.

title: Data organization in spreadsheets
learning_objectives: Learners can apply 12 principles for data organisation in spreadsheets to the layout of a provided dataset.

title: Data organization in spreadsheets
learning_objectives: Learners can discuss the difference between data in an unprocessed structure and in a processed structure.

title: Data transformation, descriptive statistics and gt
learning_objectives: Learners can apply ten functions from the dplyr R Package to generate a subset of data for use in a table or plot.

title: Data transformation, descriptive statistics and gt
learning_objectives: Learners can use functions of the gt R package to present summary tables in output formats.

title: Concept of tidy data & Vectors in R
learning_objectives: Learners can apply functions from the tidyr R Package to transform their data from a wide to a long format and vice versa.

title: Concept of tidy data & Vectors in R
learning_objectives: Learners can explain the three characteristics of tidy data.

title: Concept of tidy data & Vectors in R
learning_objectives: Learners can list the four main atomic vector types in R.

title: Joining data & wrting functions
learning_objectives: Learners can apply functions from the dplyr R Package to join multiple data sets.

title: Joining data & wrting functions
learning_objectives: Learners can write functions that reduce repition in dplyr and ggplot2 code sequences.

title: Using AI for software development in R
learning_objectives: Learners can describe the key ethical concerns related to using AI (human bias, misinformation, privacy, security, etc.)

title: Using AI for software development in R
learning_objectives: Learners are aware of the responsibility for using AI and critically and evaluating all its output.

title: Using AI for software development in R
learning_objectives: Learners can explain the basics of AI and its potential for improving software development workflows

learning_objectives: Learners can use Quarto and GitHub Pages to publish an HTML file.
